com.cyc.kb.spi

Interface RelationService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KbIndividualService, KbTermService
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryPredicateService, KbFunctionService, KbPredicateService

    public interface RelationService
extends KbIndividualService
    Provides implementations of Relation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Relation get(String nameOrId)
      throws KbTypeException,
             CreateException
        Get the Relation with the name nameOrId. Throws exceptions if there is no KB term by that name, or if it is not already an instance of #$Relation.
        Specified by:
        get in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        get in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the #$Relation
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • findOrCreate

        Relation findOrCreate(String nameOrId)
               throws CreateException,
                      KbTypeException
        Find or create a Relation object named nameOrId. If no object exists in the KB with the name nameOrId, one will be created, and it will be asserted to be an instance of #$Relation. If there is already an object in the KB called nameOrId, and it is already a #$Relation, it will be returned. If it is not already a #$Relation, but can be made into one by addition of assertions to the KB, such assertions will be made, and the object will be returned. If the object in the KB cannot be turned into a #$Relation by adding assertions (i.e. some existing assertion prevents it from being a #$Relation), a KbTypeConflictExceptionwill be thrown.
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the #$Relation
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • findOrCreate

        Relation findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
                      String constraintColStr)
               throws CreateException,
                      KbTypeException
        Find or create a Relation object named nameOrId, and also make it an instance of constraintCol in the default context specified by DefaultContext#forAssertion(). If no object exists in the KB with the name nameOrId, one will be created, and it will be asserted to be an instance of both #$Relation and constraintCol. If there is already an object in the KB called nameOrId, and it is already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, it will be returned. If it is not already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, but can be made so by addition of assertions to the KB, such assertions will be made, and the object will be returned. If the object in the KB cannot be turned into both a #$Relation and a constraintCol by adding assertions, a KbTypeConflictExceptionwill be thrown.
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the #$Relation
        constraintColStr - the string representation of the collection that this #$Relation will instantiate
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • findOrCreate

        Relation findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
                      String constraintColStr,
                      String ctxStr)
               throws CreateException,
                      KbTypeException
        Find or create a Relation object named nameOrId, and also make it an instance of constraintCol in ctx. If no object exists in the KB with the name nameOrId, one will be created, and it will be asserted to be an instance of both #$Relation and constraintCol. If there is already an object in the KB called nameOrId, and it is already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, it will be returned. If it is not already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, but can be made so by addition of assertions to the KB, such assertions will be made, and the object will be returned. If the object in the KB cannot be turned into both a #$Relation and a constraintCol by adding assertions, a KbTypeConflictExceptionwill be thrown.
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the term
        constraintColStr - the string representation of the collection that this #$Relation will instantiate
        ctxStr - the context in which the resulting object must be an instance of constraintCol
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • findOrCreate

        Relation findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
                      KbCollection constraintCol)
               throws CreateException,
                      KbTypeException
        Find or create a Relation object named nameOrId, and also make it an instance of constraintCol in the default context specified by DefaultContext#forAssertion(). If no object exists in the KB with the name nameOrId, one will be created, and it will be asserted to be an instance of both #$Relation and constraintCol. If there is already an object in the KB called nameOrId, and it is already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, it will be returned. If it is not already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, but can be made so by addition of assertions to the KB, such assertions will be made, and the object will be returned. If the object in the KB cannot be turned into both a #$Relation and a constraintCol by adding assertions, a KbTypeConflictExceptionwill be thrown.
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the #$Relation
        constraintCol - the collection that this #$Relation will instantiate
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • findOrCreate

        Relation findOrCreate(String nameOrId,
                      KbCollection constraintCol,
                      Context ctx)
               throws CreateException,
                      KbTypeException
        Find or create a Relation object named nameOrId, and also make it an instance of constraintCol in ctx. If no object exists in the KB with the name nameOrId, one will be created, and it will be asserted to be an instance of both #$Relation and constraintCol. If there is already an object in the KB called nameOrId, and it is already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, it will be returned. If it is not already both a #$Relation and a constraintCol, but can be made so by addition of assertions to the KB, such assertions will be made, and the object will be returned. If the object in the KB cannot be turned into both a #$Relation and a constraintCol by adding assertions, a KbTypeConflictExceptionwill be thrown.
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        findOrCreate in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - the string representation or the HLID of the #$Relation
        constraintCol - the collection that this #$Relation will instantiate
        ctx - the context in which the resulting object must be an instance of constraintCol
        Returns:
        a new Relation
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • existsAsType

        boolean existsAsType(String nameOrId)
        Checks whether entity exists in KB and is an instance of #$Relation. If false, getStatus(String) may yield more information. This method is equivalent to getStatus(nameOrId).equals(KbStatus.EXISTS_AS_TYPE).
        Specified by:
        existsAsType in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        existsAsType in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        Returns:
        true if entity exists in KB and is an instance of #$Relation

      • getStatus

        KbStatus getStatus(String nameOrId)
        Returns an KbStatus enum which describes whether nameOrId exists in the KB and is an instance of #$Relation.
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface KbIndividualService
        Specified by:
        getStatus in interface KbTermService
        Parameters:
        nameOrId - either the name or HL ID of an entity in the KB
        Returns:
        an enum describing the existential status of the entity in the KB
